body.name: FIFINE Microphone Boom Arm, Low Profile Adjustable Stick Microphone Arm Stand with Desk Mount Clamp, Screw Adapter, Cable Management, for Podcast Streaming Gaming Studio-BM88
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 17. Order within 2 hrs 53 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 17. Order within 11 hrs 59 mins
features: [Sturdy Metal] The support capacity of the all metal microphone arm stand can reach 1.5kg/3.3lbs, providing stability for your podcast microphone.
[Low Profile] The arm stand can extend from the bottom of your computer screen. The mic stand saves more space in a unobstructing view.

[Cable Management] The boom stand is equipped with cable managements in hiddenness to organize your microphone cables. Neat arrangement of cable will not cause excessive pulling or resulting in unexpected use.

[Fully Adjustment] Suspension arm stand can be extended to 29 inches, suitable for your long large office desktop. The boom arm can be adjusted up to down by 220 degrees, and horizontally by 360 degrees. More angle adjustments provide more usage options.

[Screw Adapter] Coming with three kinds of threads size, 1/4’’, 3/8’’, 5/8’’, the microphone boom arm solves the hassle of choosing additional adapters. You can easily and quickly install and use microphones, shock mounts, cameras, etc with the mic stand.

TIPS: 1) The desk clamp is suitable for desktop with a thickness of 0.8 to 2.4in. 2) The microphone is not included. 3) The package including, boom arm stand*1, desk clamp*1, rotatable ball-head*1, allen wrench*1, user’s manual*1. 4) Two adapters (1/4'' to 3/8'' adapter and 3*8'' to 5/8'' adapter) are already connected on the rotatable ball-head.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I really like it
reviews.reviewText: Switched from a really cheap mic stand to this when I saw in on sale during 2023 black Friday. This solved the issues with my previous one which is its ability to hold the same position and have more range of motion. This thing is super good at both of those, I can now have it positioned perfectly towards my mouth to get a way better pick up than previously. In addition having the two articulating points makes swinging it out of the way when not in use a ease. This is a low profile arm but still allows you to have your mouse arm under it without hitting it as I do with my setup. It has built in tool less cable management that I love a lot. Only minor critique I have is where it slots into the clamp could be bit more tight in tolerance as it has some wiggle room but since its solid no way is your mic going anywhere.Summary:Large range of motion+Sturdy+Low profile+Price point+Built in cable management+Includes adapters for assortment of mics+Some wiggle at base-

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I don't usually write reviews unless something is extraordinarily terrible or extraordinarily great. And this is the latter. I'm not exaggerating when I say that this has significantly improved my desk setup. I was initially hesitant about the range of motion of this compared to my old mic clamp since it seemed so low, but this can reach the same height as my old one without forcing me to rearrange everything on my desk.The arm is smooth and flexible when moving, but also sturdy enough to hold my mic up without drooping. I cannot stress how rare that is to find. The low profile arm is low enough to pass under my monitor but also long enough so that it doesn't hit my monitor when I'm elevating it, and it's also simple to tuck away when I'm not using it. Whoever designed this has simply thought of everything. Cable management is clean. I'd recommend this to anyone who has a dual monitor setup, or heck, even a single monitor setup.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price
reviews.reviewText: I got this because I bought a fifine microphone (which I love) so I thought why not get the arm sold by the same brand, that makes sense, right? But I wish I had spent a little more money to get one that was higher quality. That said, it has served me well and is not a bad product for the price. It is very sturdy/secure/stable, but it's not as adjustable as I would like (I had never used a microphone before so I didn't know what to look for). I ended up just not tightening certain parts all the way so that I can rotate it (horizontally), which you can't do if you tighten it like you should. The distance adjustment (the hinges on the arm that bend vertically) are good enough for me, although getting the height and distance right at the same time is pretty finnicky (other reviewers have explained that better, idk). All-in-all, it was good for me at the time, but I plan to replace it soon now that I have a better idea of the range-of-motion I need. Unfortunately, the next one I buy will not be at the amazing price of only $19.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Built like a tank. Low profile (:
reviews.reviewText: The BM88 is a low-profile boom arm built out of metal and has robust metal construction. I love that the handle on the C-Clamp can be rotated without tightening, giving you more options to mount it.The low-profile design of the BM88 stays out of your way, giving you more space on your desk. This can be moved 360 degrees around and adjusted upwards up to 29 inches. My favorite feature is the cable management built into the mount, which makes your setup look neater and more aesthetically pleasing.This is the best boom arm I have found, and I love the look and feel of it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Mic stand has great maneuverability, easy assembly and great metal quality and somewhere to hide cables. super rad

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A well-made and sturdy boom arm.Construction:- Made from solid cast aluminum with integrated channels to route cables.- Smooth adjustable tension using the supplied Allen key wrench to suit most needs- Minimal play or slop in articulation- Powder coated with a matte finish - fingerprint-resistant- Adjustable Mic attachment point with 1/4’’, 3/8’’, 5/8 threaded mic adapters included- Holds my 2lb Rode PodMicCons:- Rear attachment is swing only with no up/down articulation- Mic attachment point does not allow a full 180-degree up/down movementSummary: This compact, well-made Microphone Boom should suit most desktop pod casters' requirements. If you are looking for a more compact out of your way solution this is a good choice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value! Better then the competitiors for half the price!
reviews.reviewText: The FIFINE boom arm promises sleek style and adjustable support for your microphone. Does it deliver smooth sounds and a clutter-free setup? Let's check the mic:Pros:Low Profile Look: Stays close to your desk, saving space and maintaining a clean aesthetic.Smooth Operator: Adjustable arms glide effortlessly for precise mic positioning.Cable Concealer: Built-in channels keep your cables hidden, avoiding tangles and messy wires.Strong & Steady: Sturdy metal construction holds your microphone securely, without wobbles.Cons:Reach Restriction: Limited arm extension might not be ideal for everyone's setup.Clamp Clunk: Some users report the desk clamp feeling a bit flimsy or challenging to secure tightly.Threadbare Threads: Standard 3/8" adapter might not fit all microphones, requiring additional purchases.Pricey for Basic: While functional, the price might feel steep for a basic boom arm compared to some competitors.Verdict:The FIFINE boom arm offers a space-saving and stylish solution for microphone positioning. Its smooth adjustments and cable management are great, but consider the limited reach, potential clamp issues, and adapter needs before dropping the mic (money).In short:Get it if: You prioritize a low-profile, cable-free setup and don't mind a basic, compact arm.Skip it if: You need maximum reach, have a non-standard mic thread, or prefer a more robust and feature-rich arm.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Can't hold up the mic
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this microphone arm stand for my son, but it can't hold up his mic. Not strong enough. Maybe it is fit for the other mic.

The media could not be loaded. El brazo fifine es el mejor brazo que existe sin duda, es de perfil bajo por lo cual te da más libertad y movimiento al momento de estar en el escritorio, la calidad es 10 de 10 a diferencia de los tradicionales brazos el fifine los supera por mucho

reviews.reviewTitle: Does what it's supposed to do.
reviews.reviewText: I bought a second one because the first one worked well when recording with my condensor mics. Delivery was prompt.
its a good product and is very sturdy for its price, would recommend

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointed: The thread at the mic holding end is tight.
reviews.reviewText: I first used the arm with a AT2035 mic with an attached extension. It worked fine. But when I tried attaching the shock mount of the AT2035 directly to the arm, the thread is tight and won’t let in the mount fully to secure properly. Didn’t expect from Fifin to have such a glitch. The thread is not clean. But by the time the return window is closed and can’t return.Also the arm is too stiff to maneuver. Better to be a little more relaxed. Hope the brand listens.Rest assured the build quality and materials are great. Hope this helps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: After having one low profile mic arm, we wanted another one to go in our other space. Well as soon as I saw Fifine had their own, I needed to get this one immediately!I have a lot of fifine products as I cannot fault their quality or price and this is no different!It's a low profile mic arm, it has a great range of movement and tucks away nicely! It also has built in cable management which is amazing!This is well made, very sturdy and looks really sleek.The product comes with all the instructions to set it up, although you probably won't need them as it's a breeze to put together.I would highly recommend this arm to anyone who is in the market for something like this.
